alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Okeechobee, northwestern Indian River, south central Brevard and eastern Osceola Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Marian to 6 miles north of Kissimmee Prarie Preserve. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Marian, Holopaw, Kenansville and Forever Florida. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
